You are wrong @vaccinated netori means the protagonist steals the girls while netorase mean the protagonist is openly sharing his girl the netorare part is right

@AbdulBhangi cont'd: While cuckolding has traditionally been viewed as something that happens only to men, in modern storytelling, the genders of the characters involved aren't all that important ... A story in which a female protagonist watched her partner cheat would therefore be considered netorare, and it could arouse the same feelings of betrayal and helpless anger as it might if the character were male ... At least among certain readers, if the story were well told

@AbdulBhangi: No offense, but I think you may have some misconceptions about netorare & NTR ... Netorare means *passive* cuckolding ... In netorare stories, the protagonist's loved one (spouse, partner, or unrequited flame) is "stolen" by another ... Viewpoint is the key ... For a story to qualify as netorare, the narrative must encourage the reader to share the cuckold's POV, often as they literally watch their own cuckolding ... Netorase is the opposite of this ... Netorase means *active* cuckolding, so in netorase, the viewpoint protagonist steals someone else's love ... Netori just means cheating: cuckolding in general ... Netori stories are told from a cheater's viewpoint, as they betray their partner ... NTR typically means netorare, but it can also mean netorase or netori ... And netorare stories don't have to be sad & traumatic ... They can be lighthearted, and some feature MCs who happily give their partners permission to cheat

This is definitely NOT a netorare story ... I say this because Akari is hardly involved, and we don't ever see the betrayal from her (the passive cuckold's) POV ... We *might* call it netorase, because Yui does actively steal Akari's boyfriend ... But the story isn't really told from her (the active thief's) POV either ... It definitely IS a netori/cheating story, because Hiro cheats on Akari, and he's clearly the protagonist ... The narrative encourages us to view the action from his POV ... Also, since NTR can mean any or all of these things (netorare, netorase and/or netori), it's definitely that too: an NTR story that isn't netorare

In other words she is 'defeminated' and feels bad about failing to be a proper woman for her lover.  For eg -  see 311031, 182053, 276790.

@A CULTURED WEEB
NTR is highly gender specific genre, it's hard to describe but usually not all cheating doujins are NTR. The tags here are shit, don't bother with them.  
NTR is a specific type of hentai where the protag is emasculsted, his worth as a man is destroyed and in shambles and this is why many self inserting vanillafags find it very traumatic. The self insert-kun has failed to be a man for his wife/lover and hence why he got it. 
In contrast when women get cheated on,  her worth as a woman isn't usually de-feminated(or whatever female version of emasculated is), she don't feel her worth as a woman is reduced,  that she failed to be a proper lover/wife/gf for the man and hence why he cheated(Both irl and in usual such stories). He anger is more directed towards the man for failing her expectations. 
There is a name for stuff where girls get cheated,  I think it's called netare or something,  not NTR(netorare). When the protag steals someone's girl is netori.
